      • lookup

        public void lookup(EndpointPromise future)
        Description copied from interface: EndpointService
        Called by the client each time it needs to make a decision about which endpoint to attempt a connection to.

        When the operation completes the promise (supplied as an argument) is used to notify the client of the outcome. If an endpoint is available it will be supplied to the Promise.setSuccess(Object) method. If no endpoints are currently available, the client can be advised to wait for a period of time before calling this method again using the EndpointPromise.setWait(long) method. Indicating failure by calling the Promise.setFailure(Exception) will cause the client to transition into stopped state.

        Parameters:
        future - a promise that is to be completed when the endpoint service has completed the lookup request.

      • onSuccess

        public void onSuccess(Endpoint endpoint)
        Description copied from interface: EndpointService
        Called by the client when it has successfully established a connection to one of the endpoints returned by this service. This allows the endpoint service to optimise the order in which it returns endpoints (for example to implement an algorithm that always returns the most recently successful endpoints first).

        protected long calculateDelay(int retryCount)
